meanings.sent1: The farmer dug a sheuch to channel water to the crops.
meanings.sent2: I tripped over a sheuch in the field.
meanings.sent3: The ants marched in a line along the tiny sheuch.
meanings.sent4: Her wrinkled brow resembled a deep sheuch in the landscape of her face.
meanings.sent5: The sheuch in the road was a hazard for cyclists.

meanings.definition: To dig or make a trench or furrow.
meanings.sent1: He used a shovel to sheuch the soil for planting.
meanings.sent2: The workers sheuched a path through the rocky terrain.
meanings.sent3: She tried to sheuch a hole in the sand but it kept filling up.
meanings.sent4: The dog sheuched up the yard looking for buried treasure.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist carefully sheuched the ancient ruins for artifacts.

meanings.sent1: The squirrel made a quick sheuch up the tree.
meanings.sent2: I felt a sheuch of excitement when I won the race.
meanings.sent3: The cat made a sudden sheuch to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sheuch of wind blew the leaves off the tree.
meanings.sent5: The sheuch of the roller coaster made my stomach drop.
